intro: Quekettia carinata, commonly known as the mountain holly. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae, typically found in alpine and subalpine regions. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are leathery and densely packed, providing structural support in harsh environments. Quekettia carinata plays a role in stabilizing soil in rocky areas and supports local biodiversity.
